Russian Federal Space Agency sent 14 bea: Russian Federal Space Agency bears sent to space Russian space agency animals in space history

That's right, the Soviet Union sent several bears into space as part of their space program in the 1960s. The idea to send bears into space originated with the Soviet Air Force's chief physician, Dr. Vladimir Yazdovsky.
Russian Federal Space Agency bears sent to space Russian space agency animals in space history

On 19 August 1960 the Soviet Union launched Sputnik 5 (also known as Korabl-Sputnik 2) which carried the dogs Belka and Strelka, along with a gray rabbit, 40 mice, 2 rats, and 15 flasks of fruit flies and plants. It was the first spacecraft to carry animals into orbit and return them alive.
